Yeah, sometimes you need to set fallback linking libraries. It feels a little dirty, but that is the way to get this done as `conda-build` hasn't changed everything to `@rpath`s yet. Take a look at `vigra`'s build [script](https://github.com/conda-forge/vigra-feedstock/blob/9f68e98a1332330656241fd25225a4c184eaba92/recipe/build.sh#L79) too for another example.

Are we just copying this because the copy included here supports Python 2/3? I'm asking because I know this file already exists in a standard copy of LAPACK. Maybe we should just apply the patch that you submitted. No real strong opinion. Just a thought.

Also, do you have a link for your patch submission?

@jakirkham, Yes it adds py 2/3 support, but I sent the entire file instead of a real patch as it basically changed the whole file because of the fixed indentation. I do not have the revision either because they are migrating to git and told me it will be applied once the migration is over.

> Yes it adds py 2/3 support, but I sent the entire file instead of a real patch as it basically changed the whole file because of the fixed indentation.
